metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7300 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Absolute path traversal vulnerability in cantata before 1.2.2 allows local users to read arbitrary files via a full pathname in a request to the internal httpd server.  NOTE: this vulnerability can be leveraged by remote attackers using CVE-2013-7301. Automatically started HTTP server listens on all interfaces and will serve any file that the user running the HTTP server has access to, including e.g. ssh private keys.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cantata - 1.1.3-0ubuntu1~ubuntu13.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> according to debian bug, 1.1.3 is not vulnerable to this issue

criterions.comment: cantata package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.3-0ubuntu1~ubuntu13.11').
